comments:

Jerry,
WTP 0.7 is not compatible with Eclipse 3.2. In this particular case, the reason was that one of the classes in WTP 0.7 (ProjectCreationDataModelProvider) was using an internal class from Eclipse 3.1 (CoreFileSystemLibrary) which no longer exists in Eclipse 3.2. CoreFileSystemLibrary is no longer used by ProjectCreationDataModelProvider. You can either revert to Eclipse 3.1, or try moving up to WTP 1.0 M9 which should be happier with Eclipse 3.2.

Chuck,
Leap in if any of the above sounds off.

Thanks for the update.  The update manager in Eclipse 3.2 'selected' WTP 0.7.1 when I went through the update process to install my plug-ins.  In this case, it seems the update manager should not have allowed me to install an incompatible release.  I'll upgrade to 1.0M9.

Thanks.
